Scan a data frame for pattern-matching values (e.g., "*")

star_scan.Rd

This function scans all columns in a data frame and identifies which columns contain values matching a given pattern (e.g., `"*"` for suppression). It returns a list with the names of the columns containing matches and a summary of how many matches were found in each.

Usage

star_scan(df, pattern = "*", fixed = TRUE, print = TRUE)

Arguments

df

A data frame to scan.

pattern

A character string containing the pattern to match. Default is `"*"`.

fixed

Logical. If TRUE (default), `pattern` is treated as a fixed string. If FALSE, it's treated as a regular expression.

print

Logical. If TRUE (default), prints a message showing which columns matched.

Value

A list with two elements:

columns

A character vector of column names containing matches.

summary

A tibble summarizing how many matches were found per column.

Examples

suppress_cols <- star_scan(chronic24)$columns 
#> Error in star_scan(chronic24): could not find function "star_scan"
